prompt: Photorealistic, wide shot. A brightly lit, modern art gallery, focus on a single oil painting hanging on a white wall. In the foreground, a diverse group of people, some in business attire, others in casual wear, are observing the painting. One person is holding a small notebook, seemingly taking notes. The painting itself is abstract expressionist in style, with vibrant colors and bold brushstrokes. Soft, diffused lighting enhances the colors and textures. The composition is balanced to emphasize both the artwork and the audience's interaction with it. --ar 16:9
name: how-to-value-art-image-1.png

prompt: Dramatic, photorealistic close-up of an art appraiser examining a painting under a magnifying glass. The painting is partially visible, revealing details of aged canvas and cracked varnish. The appraiser's hands are gloved and steady. The background is blurred, suggesting a dimly lit, antique-filled office. Focus is razor-sharp on the point of contact between the magnifying glass and the painting's surface. Use shallow depth of field to isolate the subject. High detail, showcasing textures and imperfections. --ar 16:9
name: how-to-value-art-image-2.png

prompt: Photorealistic aerial view of a bustling art auction in progress. The scene is filled with people bidding, auctioneers hammering, and large screens displaying artwork and prices. The architecture is grand and ornate, with high ceilings and elegant chandeliers. The lighting is a mix of natural light from large windows and warm, artificial light from spotlights. The composition captures the energy and excitement of the auction, conveying a sense of high stakes and financial value. --ar 16:9
name: how-to-value-art-image-3.png

prompt: Photorealistic, wide panoramic landscape of a well-organized art storage facility. Rows upon rows of paintings, sculptures, and other artworks are neatly arranged on shelves and racks. The facility is clean, climate-controlled, and secure. The lighting is even and bright, showcasing the sheer volume of art. Use leading lines and perspective to create a sense of depth and scale. The scene conveys the idea of art as an investment and a stored asset. --ar 16:9
name: how-to-value-art-image-4.png

prompt: Photorealistic, conceptual image. A stack of crisp hundred-dollar bills partially obscures a famous painting (e.g., Mona Lisa, but altered to avoid copyright issues). The background is a dark, neutral color. The lighting is dramatic, with a single spotlight highlighting the money and the edge of the painting. The image conveys the direct link between art and monetary value, creating a visual metaphor for the art market. Focus is sharp on the texture of the money and the painting's surface. --ar 16:9
name: how-to-value-art-image-5.png
